Rule.errorMessage: The hmlid root is formatted like an OID.
Rule.solutionText: No solution needed. This is a good thing.

Rule.errorMessage: The hmlid root is not formatted like an OID.
Rule.solutionText: Please format the hmlid node's root attribute like an OID: 11.234.55555.65

Rule.errorMessage: On a sbt-ngs node, test-id is not formatted like a GTR test ID.
Rule.solutionText: Other test formats are allowed. It isn't necessary to only use a GTR test ID: GTR000000000.0

Rule.errorMessage: On a sbt-ngs node, the test-id-source is not explicitly 'NCBI-GTR'.
Rule.solutionText: Other options are allowed. It isn't necessary to only use NCBI-GTR'

Rule.errorMessage: On a reference sequence node, end attribute should be greater than or equal to the start attribute.
Rule.solutionText: The end attribute should be greater than or equal to the start attribute.

Rule.errorMessage: A reference-sequence node has an id attribute with no corresponding consensus-sequence-block id attribute.
Rule.solutionText: This is a warning, not a serious error. consensus-sequence-block:reference-sequence-id must have a corresponding reference-sequence:id, but the opposite is not necessarily true.

Rule.errorMessage: On a sequence quality node, the sequence-start and sequence-end attributes must be between 0 and (consensus-sequence-block:end - consensus-sequence-block:start) inclusive.
Rule.solutionText: A sequence-quality node has a sequence-start and sequence-end attributes. They refer to positions within the consensus-sequence-block, and therefore must be contained within the range of parent's end and start.

Rule.errorMessage: The start attribute on a consensus-sequence-block node should be greater than or equal to the start attribute
Rule.solutionText: Verify that the consensus-sequence-block:start is greater than or equal to start, and consensus-sequence-block:end is less than or equal to end on the corresponding reference-sequence.

Rule.errorMessage: The end attribute on a consensus-sequence-block node should be less than or equal to the end attribute
Rule.solutionText: Verify that the consensus-sequence-block:start is greater than or equal to start, and consensus-sequence-block:end is less than or equal to end on the corresponding reference-sequence.

Rule.errorMessage: For every consensus-sequence-block node, the child sequence node must have a length of (end - start).
Rule.solutionText: Please check the sequence length against the start and end attributes.

Rule.errorMessage: On a consensus-sequence-block node, the phasing-group attribute is deprecated.
A consensus-sequence-block with attribute continuity=true does not appear to be continuous
Rule.solutionText: Any consensus-sequence-block node with continuity=true is expected to be continuous with the previous sibling node. Start=End(previous). The previous node will have the same reference-sequence-id and phase-set, if applicable.

Rule.errorMessage: On a variant node, end attribute should be greater than or equal to the start attribute
Rule.solutionText: The end attribute should be greater than or equal to the start attribute.

Rule.errorMessage: The start attribute on a variant node should be greater than or equal to the start attribute
Rule.solutionText: Verify that variant:start is greater than or equal to the start, and variant:end is less than or equal to the end attribute on the corresponding reference-sequence.

Rule.errorMessage: The end attribute on a variant node should be less than or equal to the end attribute
Rule.solutionText: Verify that variant:start is greater than or equal to the start, and variant:end is less than or equal to the end attribute on the corresponding reference-sequence.

Rule.errorMessage: The variant nodes under a single consensus-sequence-block must have id attributes that are integers ranging from 0:n-1, where n is the number of variants.
Rule.solutionText: IDs on variant nodes should start at 0, and represent every integer between 0:n-1.
